intro: Rockhausenia castroviejoi, commonly known as the Castroviejo's rockhausenia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Spain. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are small and white, often arranged in compact clusters, while its leaves are finely divided and aromatic. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
